alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 8:51AM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM PEAKS TODAY-TONIGHT BUT CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected at times. Additional snow accumulations mainly between 4 and 10 inches, the majority falling today and tonight, with highest amounts favoring areas north of Interstate 80. Northwest winds gusting 30 to 40 MPH today, but decreasing to 20 to 30 MPH most areas on Tuesday. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska, including the Tri Cities. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile at times due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact Christmas and post-Christmas travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although true blizzard conditions with 1/4 mile visibility or less will likely only occur on an occasional basis, snow and blowing snow will frequently reduce visibility to under 1 mile.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle.
